citation.article-title: Marinomonas aquamarina sp. nov., isolated from oysters and seawater

p.s: Description of M. aquamarina sp. nov.
Marinomonas aquamarina (a.qua.ma.ri’na L. n. aqua water; L. adj. marina of the sea; F.L. adj. aquamarina pertaining to seawater).
Gram negative, straight rods, 1–4 μm length by 0.5–1 μm width, motile by a polar flagellum.
Colonies on MA are smooth, convex, with regular edges, and non-pigmented.
Do not reduce nitrates to nitrites nor gas and do not accumulate PHB intracellularly.
Negative for production of indole, sulphide, ADH, ODC and LDC.
Strains have a strict Na+ requirement and tolerate up to 10% NaCl.
Do not grow at 4 °C but good growth is observed up to 40 °C.
Negative for hydrolysis of gelatin, casein, starch, alginate, agar, Tween-80 and DNA.
Aromatic compounds are degraded via meta cleavage.

Growth is supported by the following compounds as sole carbon and energy sources on BMA: d-glucose, d-fructose, d-gluconate, d-glycerate, propionate, pyruvate, citrate, 2-ketoglutarate, succinate, fumarate, malate, acetate, d,l-lactate, p-hydroxybenzoate, glycine, l-serine, l-glutamate, l-alanine, γ-aminobutyrate, l-ornithine, sarcosine, l-aspartate and l-histidine.
The following compounds are weakly utilized: d-ribose, d-mannose, d-glucosamine, aconitate, l-citrulline, l-glutamine.

In the same conditions no growth was obtained with: l-arabinose, d-xylose, d-galactose, d-trehalose, l-rhamnose, maltose, d-cellobiose, sucrose, lactose, d-melibiose, d-raffinose, salicin, amygdalin, d-glucuronate, d-galacturonate, N-acetyl d-glucosamine, glycerol, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, m-inositol, methanol, d-saccharate, 3-hydroxybutyrate, l-leucine, l-threonine, l-lysine and putrescine.
The 16S rDNA sequences of strains CECT 5080T, CECT 5081 and CECT 5078 have been deposited in the EMBL under the accession numbers AJ843077, AJ843078 and AJ843079.
The type strain of the species is CECT 5080T (11SM4T), isolated from seawater at the Mediterranean coast of Spain.
It is also deposited at other culture collections as CIP 108405T and CCUG 49439T.
This strain was originally reported to be motile by one polar flagellum, but, currently is non-motile.
